tutorial.title: Best Movie Webpage
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use Flexbox to align a webpage featuring the best movies of the past

executableContent.instructions:
In this project, we'll use our knowledge of **flex-direction** to create a webpage that displays the top-rated movies from 2017 - 2021.

We already have an HTML webpage with some styling. We'll focus on finishing the rest of the CSS to create a result like the below.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Best Movies

2017 - Lady Bird
2018 - Black Panther
2019 - Parasite
2020 - One Night of Miami
2021 - Nomadland

files.name: style.css
script.js

executableContent.instructions:
As a first step, we'll add a CSS selector to style the `<div>` element containing the movies.

1. Add a CSS selector for the elements with the CSS Class `container`.

executableContent.instructions:
Looks great in reverse as well. To make the webpage interactive, we already had a script and some buttons set up to change the `flex-direction` whenever we click them. You can take a look at `script.js` if you want. 

You don't have to worry about that now, all you need to remember is that flexbox can be very powerful and useful when it comes to changing a website's layout.

executableContent.instructions:
Before this last step, it's important to run your code and take a look at the result.

Notice that if we try to expand the website, the buttons and flexbox items don't line up well. Let's fix that. 

1. Inside the `.container` selector, align the content to the `center`.
2. Inside the same selector, justify the content to the `center`.
